tn.text: to strengthen the faith of
"that is suitable for honoring God"

tn.ref: before all the ages of time
tn.text: "before time began"
"At the proper time"
Paul speaks of God's message as if it were an object that could be visibly shown to people. AT: "He caused me to understand his message" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
"he trusted me to bring" or "he gave me the responsibility to preach"
"God, who saves us"

Though Titus was not Paul's biological son, they share a common faith in Christ. Thus, in Christ, Paul considers Titus as his own son. AT: "you are like a son to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
Paul expresses the same faith in Christ that they both share. AT: "the teachings that we both believe"
This was a common greeting Paul used. You can state clearly the understood information. AT: "May you experience kindness and peace within" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
"Christ Jesus who is our savior"
"This is the reason"
"I told you to stay in Crete"

tn.ref: that you might set in order things not yet complete
tn.text: "so that you would finish arranging things that needed to be done"
"appoint elders" or "designate elders"
In the early Christian churches, Christian elders gave spiritual leadership to the assemblies of believers.
Paul continues giving Titus reasons to preach God's word, and explains how the older men, older women, young men, and slaves or servants should live as believers.
Paul implies what is in contrast. AT: "But you, Titus, in contrast with the false teachers, be sure to say those things that fit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
"with sound doctrine" or "with correct teachings"
"to be sober-minded" or "to be self-controlled"
"to ... control their desires"

tn.ref: sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance
tn.text: Here the word "sound" means to be firm and unwavering. The abstract nouns "faith," "love," and "perseverance" can be stated as verbs. AT: "and they must firmly believe the true teachings about God, truly love others, and continually serve God even when things are difficult" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
"In the same way, teach older women" or "Also teach older women"
This word refers to people who say bad things about other people whether they are true or not.

tn.ref: or being slaves to much wine
tn.text: A person who cannot control themselves and drinks too much wine is spoken of as if the person were a slave to the wine. This can be stated in active form. AT: "and not drinking too much wine" or "and not addicted to wine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])

tn.ref: so that God's word may not be insulted
tn.text: "Word" here is a metonym for "message," which in turn is a metonym for God himself. This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that no one insults God's word" or "so that no one insults God by saying bad things about his message" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
